meanings.definition: To gather or contract into folds or wrinkles
meanings.sent1: She puckered her lips before giving a kiss.
meanings.sent2: The fabric puckered as she sewed it together.
meanings.sent3: The balloon puckered up when she squeezed it, making a funny noise.
meanings.sent4: His forehead puckered in confusion as he tried to solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The flower puckered its petals tightly to protect itself from the rain.

meanings.definition: Having wrinkles or folds, especially on fabric or skin
meanings.sent1: The puckered edges of the blanket added a cozy texture.
meanings.sent2: Her puckered hands showed years of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The puckered fabric looked like a crumpled paper ball.
meanings.sent4: The old book had puckered pages from being read so many times.
meanings.sent5: The puckered surface of the moon made it look like a giant wrinkled rock.
